articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Giant asteroid 1998 OR2 set to fly past Earth safely - Aljazeera.com
articles.description: The space rock heading to Earth has been classified as a 'potentially hazardous object', but scientists say 1998 OR2 is not a threat.
articles.content:
A large asteroid, 1998 OR2, will fly past Earth on Wednesday.
Astronomers say the asteroid, more than a mile (1.6km) wide, will not collide with our planet but will get close enough for us to study it.
Al Jazeera's Andy Gallacher reports from Florida, US.

articles.author: Callum Hoare
articles.title: End of the world: How scientist revealed date ‘life on Earth will become very problematic’ - Express.co.uk
articles.description: THE end of the world may not happen tomorrow, but scientists are very aware of an event in the future which will make 'life on Earth very problematic'.

articles.description: The crew of three returned to Earth on Friday after 205 days at the International Space Station.
articles.content:
